title: Peasant Wright
author: Peasant Wright
content: What keyboard is the most used with good review that I can use to import my recovery seed into a new wallet? I am scared that my recovery seed can be revealed, I am using a fancy keyboard I downloaded from Google playstore but I read somewhere on here that another keyboard that doesn't follow your phone from factory is bad. Since the one that came with my phone is buggy what do you think I should do now?

comments.author: OmegaStarScream
comments.body: If you think the keyboard you're using is harmful, then you should uninstall it and just install Gboard instead (assuming that's not the one that came with your phone).

comments.author: DdmrDdmr
comments.body: Quote from: Peasant Wright on February 04, 2023, 04:58:10 PM<…>This is what I mentioned on the matter a few months ago:Quote from: DdmrDdmr on October 23, 2022, 04:37:50 PM<…> Smartphones, and more specifically, android based ones, are potential targets of malicious apps and fake apps  stealing your data, and that can of course apply to keyboards that you install (see for example this thread). It could even happen unintentionally, as a result of data they amass that one may not be aware of, which can eventually get leaked. Hell, you’ve even got to be wary of text prediction options.Follow the above links to see some interesting reads on the matter, that depict why it is not a good idea to use alternative keyboards on your phone.It’s not just a question of finding the keyboard to import your recovery seed, but rather being conscious that, when privacy and valuables are at stake, the less (crap one installs) is always going to turn out being the better.

comments.body: Quote from: OmegaStarScream on February 04, 2023, 05:03:12 PMIf you think the keyboard you're using is harmful, then you should uninstall it and just install Gboard instead (assuming that's not the one that came with your phone).Yah Gboard is trusted keyboard one of them, I also agree with you that this is the best keyboard for mobile there is no doubt about it. However, most phones have their own developed keyboards that can be used with them if found convenient.(it means if used to comfortable).

comments.author: Cruxleo
comments.body: Heading right back to default is best.But if you want to continue using other keyboards that you can trust maybe because of some added features I would suggest keyboards with digital keystroke encryption, such as Kika Keyboard, Fleksy Keyboards and SwiftKey. These are built to protect against hackers interrupting your keystrokes, to help keep your data safe as you write or copy.

comments.author: Z390
comments.body: Uninstall the present keyboard you are using and import your recovery seed phrase using the default keyboard, then reinstall back whatever keyboard you like will like to use, either the new one or look for Gboard or Grammarly keyboard, these two are the most widespread judging from the number of downloads on google play store. Avoid fondness looking keyboards that changes looks and colors, they ask for permission to files I don't like.

comments.author: nakamura12
comments.body: Use the default keyboard on your phone when you import the existing wallet to a new wallet that you are using but as others have said that you must uninstall the keyboard first before you import the wallet if you are afraid that the keyboard you installed can copy the content that you will type. Well, you can always install it again once you are done importing the wallet. I am also using Gboard and it seems okay and didn't have any problems.

comments.author: un_rank
comments.body: Quote from: Z390 on February 04, 2023, 05:27:35 PMUninstall the present keyboard you are using and import your recovery seed phrase using the default keyboard, then reinstall back whatever keyboard you like will like to useIf you suspect that a keyboard is potentially compromised, then the risk posed is not only from importing your seedphrase, using it on a device where you have stored your assets puts you at risk.It is best to keep it uninstalled and ensure that any app you do install on that device is one which is really needed.- Jay -

Since the one that came with my phone is buggy what do you think I should do now? First I wouldn't keep any serious Bitcoin amount on any mobile wallet, especially if you are using standard android smartphone that is always connected to internet.Acceptable option would be to use your old phone offline as a part of multisig setup, or phone that is connected with your hardware wallet.In that case you won't have to worry about keyboard app you are using, but I would strongly suggest using some open source keyboard app with de-googled phone.

Since the one that came with my phone is buggy what do you think I should do now? It's either you purchase a new original phone with a good inbuilt keyboard or you try to download Gboard (not recommended though)and try if suites you.From what I know, you don't have to type the full words when inputting your secret phrases, most wallet nowadays bring out suggestions as soon as you start typing the secret phrase so even if your phone's keyboard is buggy as you said in Op it can still work, all you gat to do is just type the first three letter and you'll see so many suggestions to choose from and I for one think this is better than copying the entire secret phrase and pasting them. Op, by the way,.I hope you're not using the mobile phone you're using to store your coin for other things? Because once you start to use it as a multi-purpose phone it increase the risk of the phone being infested with malware and then you won't have to only worry about your keyboard alone.

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: If you know ahead of time that the built-in keyboard is broken, and this should not happen in a working phone, then there must be a reason for this flaw.As paranoid as I am, I wouldn't trust any keyboard on your phone. How long have you been using it, and what applications do you install besides a third-party keyboard? It's also important to consider which links you click on.Alternatively, in the absence of other methods, such as a separate device, reset the phone to factory settings. But also keep in mind that some viruses remain even after recovery. Such viruses are usually installed in the recovery partition and are not removed in any way. Also, the virus may remain on your MicroSD.And finally, you can try to flash the phone yourself.

comments.author: pixie85
comments.body: You're right to be scared. Many third party programs can spy on you. If you're planning to use a phone for storing money better keep it as clean as possible and avoid Chinese brands. To be honest, I wouldn't hold a lot of money on a phone, regardless of a brand. A good rule of thumb is to spend 1% of your money on securing the rest. If you're holding $1000 it doesn't really matter if it's a phone or desktop but if it's 100 000 you better have some security and good habits when it comes to browsing and downloading stuff.
